I've never smelled that smell in
America.

KRIEGER: I live in a
"transitional" neighborhood.

ARCHER: As the crack dealers
move to nicer ones?

I mean hula girls,
a replica volcano, some --

KRIEGER: Yeah, no,
you can breathe easy.

ARCHER: Actually I can barely
breathe at all.

ARCHER: I was going to say a
literal shithole.

Krieger, how and why
do you live here?

KRIEGER: I use my salary
for "pet" projects.

I had Korean barbecue for lunch,
I cannot look at a Dr. Moreau
pig-baby.

KRIEGER: Relax,
you're gonna love this.

ARCHER: No I'm not,
and also I need to pee.

KRIEGER: Don't be nervous,
I'm not gonna rape you.

But you were gonna flay
me like a perch? !

KRIEGER: It's not if you're
black.

ARCHER: What is it with serial
killers and skin?

ARCHER: Wait,
why'd you emphasize serial?

Are we doing,
did I mention I have a surprise
for you?

ARCHER: Krieger! Equal parts
soju sangria and fear-induced
adrenaline means I have to pee.

And not in that sick bathroom,
so --

KRIEGER: O.K. There's a utility
sink in my lab.

ARCHER: Uh, is the surprise
that you're pirating cable?

KRIEGER: No, no, Archer,
I've finally cracked it!

ARCHER: Wow, amazing,
you can play YYZ.

KRIEGER: First of all,
it's Y-Y-Zed, and second of all,

no, I can't yet,
it's impossible.

KRIEGER: And third of all,
wrong thing!
There was a lot of confusion...
Gross and/or ick, and is she...?

KATYA: My darlink Sterlink,
you awake me like the prince of
Snow White!

Krieger thank you,
this is the --
why do you have an erection? !

ARCHER: Are you - thanks for
starting my sentence for me -

ARCHER: And almost nine-thirty,
Pam, in case you were thinking
about, I dunno, working.

CYRIL: Jeez,
somebody's raring to go.

ARCHER: Because I burn clean,
Cyril.

Because I don't glop up my
engine with bear claws.

ARCHER: And also because
Katya needs a W-9.

ARCHER: Well for one thing,
no bear claws.

PAM: Wait, does this mean you
and me --

MALORY: I swear to God,
if you people can't keep it

down, this is the last
Bear Claw Mon --

ARCHER: And if we don't file her
W-9 that first check will take,
like, eight weeks.

MALORY: I'm sorry,
I'm a little confused...

LANA: What, by the
dead woman standing here? !

MALORY: Dead woman my
still-shapely ass.

She's obviously a double,
carved up by KGB plastic

surgeons to look like Katya,
and --

KRIEGER: How dare you fail to
recognize my greatest
accomplishment to date? !
And no, Neil Peart stands alone.

CHERYL/CAROL: Just like the
gypsy woman said!

PAM: You need to quit going to
her.

MALORY: And you need your head
examined if you think that

abomination is ever going
to work for ISIS!

ARCHER: Baby, come on,
you're not an abomination.

I mean,
that's your original skin,
right?

I'm still processing the fact
that you're a cyborg.
PAM: Yeah, way to bury the lead.

And also,
was I not clear about that?

CYRIL: Although she does feel
a bit clammy...

Just because she's a cyborg
doesn't mean you can feel
her up!

KATYA: Da,
I hef feelinks just like all of
you.

I feel love, I leff,
I sometimes cry...

Which reminds me,
we need to talk about other, um,
internal lubricants like --

That sounds like a private
matter.

KRIEGER: Yeah,
that's what I'm talking ab --

Needs to go with Pam now to do
her stupid W-9.

That she's so jealous of
my love for Katya,

she won't hire a world-class spy
who also, spoiler alert,
can do this? !
Wait, or do I mean sploosh?

LANA: Ya know,
it's probably not the worst idea
in the world to have...

someone like her working at
ISIS, since --

CHERYL/CAROL: Since you wanna
screw affirmative action?

LANA: Since the KGB has someone
like Barry!

I'm never gonna let him hurt you
again, baby.
It is Barry who should worry!

If I ever see thet zloi mudak
again, I --

CHERYL/CAROL: Yeah he never
calls, he never writes...

ARCHER: So just go with Pam to
do your paperwork --

LANA: And I'll go try to
convince Malory
that you'll be an asset to ISIS.
LANA: So not doing it for you.

I don't want her to be an ISIS
agent,

and I certainly don't want her
and Sterling back together!

LANA: Well,
I can understand the latter --
MALORY: I mean, who wears bangs?

LANA: -- but it can't hurt to
level the playing field,
now that --

By the new head of the KGB,
who is also a cyborg.

CHERYL/CAROL: Just like the
gypsy woman said!
Katya can be an ISIS agent? !

But if I find out the KGB is
behind this --

MALORY: I'll part her out and
sell her for scrap.

And I thought you were scared of
robots!

ARCHER: I -- no, not Katya,
she's different!

Well don't come crying to me
when she breaks your heart
again.

ARCHER: She didn't break my
heart, Mother, she was murdered.

MALORY: Yes, and then
you ran away from home to, ugh,

MALORY: Oh please,
I bet the gene pool of Polynesia
is irreparably altered.

ARCHER: Baby,
I was emotionally shattered.

Which, turns out,
to be kind of a pantydropper.

ARCHER: Well,
the love of my life,

this smoking-hot woman,
was not only murdered and then

brought back to life,
she also just got a job today,
so yeah, pretty special.

ARCHER: While she thinks,
bring me some soup dumplings.

KATYA: No, no,
I am thinking about your mother.

ARCHER: God,
don't waste the ROM, or RAM,
whatever.
KATYA: Does she hate what I am?

ARCHER: What you are,
meaning "the one woman who can

free her child from the
psychological prison she's spent
a lifetime erecting?"

ARCHER: She'd hate you no matter
what you are.

KATYA: Because I did not ask to
be this way...

ARCHER: Yeah, hey, me either,
vis a vis Mother.
Do you think I am a monster?

ARCHER: Baby,
I don't care about the chips and
gears and...

All I care about is what I see
when I look into those big green

-- oh, I guess they're red now,
huh?
And what do you see in my eyes?

Lot of feelings coming together,
just trying to process.

Not gonna lie,
having some déjà vu here.
You are, how do you say?
But could you close your eyes?

I kinda feel like I'm banging
tail-lights on a country road.

ARCHER: I swear to God,
if I went blind right this very
second I'd be okay with that.

I've been doing yogic breathing
work for two hours.

ARCHER: Whatever, yes,
I call them cran-baisins.

ARCHER: Don't take this the
wrong way, but duh.
KATYA: I mean our love, darlink.

what is a giant,
unstoppable wave?

ARCHER: Wait, you know craisins,
but you don't know tsunami?

KATYA: Da, then our love
is like tsunami.

Because not only am I
lightheaded,
certain parts of me are --

They are not coming back
ARCHER: Why?

WOODHOUSE: The remedy for which,
miss, if you'll forgive
my boldness...?

KATYA: Da, please, Woodhouse,
I think boldness is needed.

WOODHOUSE: White vinegar,
mineral oil, and elbow grease.

Same thing we used in the RFC to
clean the engines on our
Sopwith Camels.

And so, with your permission,
while you breakfast on the

terrace I'll get that little
pleasure boat looking Bristol!

I took the liberty of
poaching you an egg.

KATYA: Is not much of a liberty,
considerink thet you are going
to polish my vagina.

KATYA: And when he woke up from
faint, boom!

He ren out of there fest
like crezzy.

I think if you're looking
for insight into why Archer
is...

Archer,
you need to jump in a

time machine and then go have
a treesome with Oedipus and
Sigmund Freud.

I don't really have a roadmap
for my ex finding your
robo-gina in the sink.

ARCHER: It was like a
transistor radio and a
veal cutlet had a baby!

CYRIL: -- but I don't see why
that means you have to drink my
Glengoolie Blue!

ARCHER: Because the liquor
stores aren't open yet,

and she made me pour out all the
booze at my house!

CYRIL: Yeah,
and it's three hundred a
bottle...

I -- which I haven't even
tasted yet!

Because I was saving it
for a special occasion!

Befitting a gift from my
grandfather!

ARCHER: Of course he is,
he'd be like, a hundred.

ARCHER: Just like my heart,
Cyril --

ARCHER: -- because she ripped
it out!
And threw it in the sink!
The old man knew his scotch.

That was a gift to my
grandfather!

ARCHER: Well then I feel even
worse,

because I'm probably gonna puke
it up in about five --

CYRIL: Yes! You are an asshole
about all things!

ARCHER: But, specifically, now,
about Katya.

KATYA: Or... could I hef
done something wrung?

PAM: Besides leavin yer cooch in
the sink?

KATYA: Is just,
I know he hez wery good reason
to hate...

And that's twice, sorry,
ignore me, my whole thing is
I just crave attention.

ARCHER: But I mean,
Barry did murder her -- ungh!

And more importantly,
tried to murder me!

That doesn't mean all cyborgs
are like that!

CYRIL: Well you lost me there,
thankfully, but -- Give me that!

ARCHER: What,
was that Peter Lawford's?

CYRIL: No, it was -- Oh shut up,
do you wanna learn something?

CHERYL/CAROL: Because did you
know that in Chinese,

the words for crisis and
opportunity are the same word?

They just used to say that in
the hospital.

While they made us fold those
pointy goddamn paper birds.

PAM: I think what she's trying
to say is you can either think
of this as a crisis...

CYRIL: That actually was
Peter Lawford's.

And why not,
you were gonna marry her before!

ARCHER: Before she wasn't a
cyborg.

CYRIL: She's still kind, smart,
insanely hot...

ARCHER: Yeah, and even though
it's detachable,

Ow! Ow! Dammit
You started it!

ARCHER: That's my fiancée you're
talking about!

ARCHER: I can look past our
differences, Cyril,

I'm a much bigger man than you
think.

ARCHER: Little thing called
timing, Krieger.

And the erection's really
not appropriate.

KATYA: Oh yes, yes,
a thousand times yes!

PAM: When's the wedding,
when's the wedding? !

GILLETTE: I can actually marry
y'all right here.

Wait, do you want me
to be a groomsman?

Go to the liquor store
and buy a case of --

BRETT: Sure,
I'll just limp on down there.

We're having a wedding in
a few short minutes!

GILLETTE: Okay,
bride and groom, check.

CYRIL: Oh for -- name one,
name one friend of yours.

Ray, don't you have like,
a priest outfit, or...?

GILLETTE: No, I wore it
to Fetish Night at The Snug,
and it's covered in --

And who gives this woman to be
wed in holy matrimony?

GILLETTE: And no mother of the
groom, so --

BARRY: Uh, I think other Barry
might.

BARRY: Yeah, and I brought
bubbly!

You kiss your mother-board
with that mouth?

And also,
is anybody gonna ask how and why
I knew to show up here?

BARRY: By tracking the satellite
signal from Katya's internal

hard drive,
which Doctor Dipshit over there,
bought from the KGB!

BARRY: Like,
eighty bucks you saved.

But nobody's gonna save you,
Archer.

ARCHER: Don't you have that
backwards? !

ARCHER: Why do I always forget
you're -- ungh!

BARRY: Yeah,
walk that off while I kill your
girlfriend again.

ARCHER: Actually, I don't think
I'm in any shape to dance,
right now Barry.

BARRY: The dance of death,
idiot.

But first let's
me and you cut a rug.
KATYA: Is thet the best you got?
LANA: We are if you'd shut up!

KRIEGER: Their CPU's are powered
by photovoltaic cells!

Without exposure to a
light-source they'll slowly lose
power!

KRIEGER: I -- no,
nothing like vampires, idiot!

ARCHER: Well I'm sorry,
Ira Flatow! From Newton's Apple.

If Barry gets weak enough,
maybe you can overpower him!

ARCHER: I was just gonna say
that!

ARCHER: Beset, on all sides,
by idiots...

BRETT: No, just hurt
really really badly.

Although not nearly as badly as
I am now.

MALORY: You better not be
bleeding on my carpet!

BRETT: No, pretty sure
I'm all out of blood.

ARCHER: Well serves you right,
for --

Oh Barry,
I am coming for you...

ARCHER: And after I kill you,
and defile your cyborg-y corpse,
I'm gonna -- wh-? !
ARCHER: Ray, turn the lights on!

ARCHER: Turn on the
goddamn lights!
Why do I always forget that? !
And how can you explain that? !

MALORY: What were they,
having sex? !

KATYA: As we fought,
it became more like,
like dancing.
Katya, how could you do this?

KATYA: I'm sorry I hurt you,
but I realized thet even though

you tried to see past what I em,
Barry and I are the same.

KATYA: We are like two mermaids,
we must swim together.

So I won't esk you to forgive
me,

but can you et least be heppy
for me,

because I hev finally found a
soul mate?

You will always hev a special
place in my...

BARRY: While Other Barry and I
are in her other special place.

ARCHER: Well, Mother,
go ahead and say it...

MALORY: Oh, Sterling,
you've just had your heart

broken,
you don't need a smug
"I told you so" from me.

And smug it would be,
because tell you I most
certainly did.

Just like that Electrolux
all over again.
LANA: So, I know that sucked --

LANA: No idea, thankfully,
about any of that,

but if you really did
love Katya,

you gotta be happy that
she's happy.

ARCHER: She did look
pretty happy, huh?
